I do not have access to the author's personal motivations or intentions, but it is commonly understood that the use of magical realism in "the house of the spirits" is an essential aspect of the latin american literary tradition. magical realism has its roots in the cultural and spiritual beliefs of latin america, which are steeped in the supernatural and the mystical.

furthermore, magical realism allows allende to explore complex themes such as love, politics, power, and spirituality in a unique and imaginative way. the use of magical realism is not intended to make her work seem pretentious or profound, but rather to convey her vision of the world in a way that is both engaging and thought-provoking. allende's use of magical realism has been widely praised for its ability to bring the ordinary and the fantastic together in a seamless and intriguing manner, creating a literary style that is both entertaining and informative.
